Class NotificationController

  • java.lang.Object

extends BaseController

      • getNotifications

        @RequestMapping(value="/",
                method=GET)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.notification.NotificationListApiResponse getNotifications(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                    io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser)
        GET /api/secure/notifications/

        Gets all the Notification objects in the database.

        RESPONSE: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": {
     "notifications": [Notification]
   }
 }


        PERMISSIONS:
        This method is only accessible to SUPER users.

      • getNotificationsForAuthenticated

        @RequestMapping(value="/forAuthenticated",
                method=GET)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.notification.NotificationListApiResponse getNotificationsForAuthenticated(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                                                    io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser)
        GET /api/secure/notifications/forAuthenticated

        Gets all the Notification objects owned by the authenticated User.

        RESPONSE: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": {
     "notifications": [Notification]
   }
 }


        PERMISSIONS:
        Must be an authenticated User.

      • putNotificationForAuthenticated

        @RequestMapping(value="/forAuthenticated",
                method=POST)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.notification.NotificationApiResponse putNotificationForAuthenticated(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                                                io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                                                @RequestBody
                                                                                                                                                                                                io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiNotification notification)
        POST /api/secure/notifications/forAuthenticated

        Creates a new Notification, or updates an existing notification.

        To CREATE a new notification, simply omit the "id" field from the following request body. All new notifications must have at least one locationId or deviceId.

        To UPDATE an existing notification, you must supply the "id" field in the following request body. Updates on Notifications are only allowed to modify the "active" state of the notification or the "notificationType". All other fields will be ignored for UPDATE.

        REQUEST BODY (CREATE): 
         {
   (required) "notificationType": {email|text|email_text},
   (required) "time": "hh:mm:ss",
   (semi-optional) "locationIds": [locationId1, locationId2, ...],
   (semi-optional) "deviceIds": [deviceId1, deviceId2, ...]
 }

        REQUEST BODY (UPDATE): 
         {
   (required) "id": Notification.id,
   (optional) "notificationType": {EMAIL|TEXT|EMAIL_TEXT}
   (optional) "time": "hh:mm:ss"
 }


        RESPONSE: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": Notification
 }


        PERMISSIONS:
        Must be an authenticated User.

      • setNotificationActive

        @RequestMapping(value="/{notificationId}",
                method=PUT)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.DefaultApiResponse setNotificationActive(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                   io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                   @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                   java.util.UUID notificationId,
                                                                                                                                                                   @RequestParam
                                                                                                                                                                   boolean active)
        PUT /api/secure/notifications/{notificationId}?active={true|false}
        Sets the state of a notification to "active" or "inactive" depending on the supplied parameter "active" at the end of the request URL.

        RESPONSE: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": null
 }

        PERMISSIONS:
        The user must either:
        • Own the notification
        • Be an ADMIN and own the owner of the notification
        • Be a SUPER

      • deleteNotificationById

        @RequestMapping(value="/{notificationId}",
                method=DELETE)
public io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.response.notification.NotificationApiResponse deleteNotificationById(@RequestAttribute
                                                                                                                                                                                         io.lovelacetech.server.model.api.model.ApiUser authenticatedUser,
                                                                                                                                                                                         @PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                                                         java.util.UUID notificationId)
        DELETE /api/secure/notifications/{notificationId}
        Deletes a notification by id. Returns the deleted notification in the response body.

        RESPONSE: 
         {
   "status": 200,
   "message": "success",
   "response": Notification
 }

        PERMISSIONS:
        The authenticated user must either:
        • Own the notification
        • Be an ADMIN and own the owner of the notification
        • Be a SUPER
